channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NV
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NV

item.title: Report X-2024101773
item.description:
Report X-2024101773

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-01T09:15:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-23
  • City: SPARKS
  • State: NV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO A LEAKING PACKAGE IN IRREGS. TOOK SPILL CART TO IRREG BELT TO FIND LEAKER. RESPONDER USED DECISION TREE AND FOLLOWED STEPS TO CONTAIN AND CLEAN UP LEAKER. CLEANED UP STILL AND TOOK BACK TO DMP TO PROCESS LEAKER.

item.title: Report E-2024100683
item.description:
Report E-2024100683

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-31T09:22:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-28
  • City: LAS VEGAS
  • State: NV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UVG experienced a UN1789 Aqua Balance Muriatic Acid release from a box containing (4) 1- gallon poly jugs. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 15 ounces of product released to a 4’ x 4’ area of the pallet and a 1.5’ x 1’ area of the concrete dock floor due to a forklift puncture. The impacted areas were cleaned with absorbents and sodium bicarbonate to clean and neutralize the material. The damaged jug and 3 other impacted jugs in the box were loose packed into a 55-gallon poly drum. The impacted cardboard, absorbents, pads, and PPE were placed into a second 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024101663
item.description:
Report X-2024101663

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-31T09:22:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-07
  • City: LAS VEGAS
  • State: NV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: TCBX 305013 was reported to be leaking in the UPRR Las Vegas yard, after inspection it was found that two man-way swing bolts were less than tool tight. Graymar secured the man-way and the car returned into transportation.
